title: LRS Announces Grand Opening of The Exchange, a Revolutionary Material Recovery Facility Pioneering a New Era of ... - PR Newswire
summary: LRS has opened a new state-of-the-art material recovery facility (MRF) called The Exchange in Chicago. The facility will divert 224 million pounds of recyclables annually, reducing the overall carbon footprint of the waste and recycling process. The Exchange is part of LRS's mission to become the safest, most innovative waste recycler globally.

title: New Recycling Facility Redefines ‘State of the Art’ - Business West
summary: The All American Material Recovery Facility (MRF) in Berlin, Connecticut, uses optical scanners, robotics, and AI to sort and process recyclables, resulting in high-quality materials and increased purity. The facility incorporates sustainable design elements and prioritizes worker safety and comfort, making it an innovative and environmentally friendly operation. The MRF is part of Murphy Road Recycling's portfolio of ventures that demonstrate a commitment to innovation and sustainability.

title: Rolling car tires into the global circular economy - Mongabay.com
summary: The article discusses the negative environmental impacts of tires throughout their life cycle. These impacts include deforestation, water pollution, and air pollution. There are several circular economy solutions that could be implemented to reduce these impacts. However, these solutions have limitations and trade-offs, including high energy use and the release of harmful emissions.

title: Fletcher Building to replace old particleboard line in Taupo with new Fine OSB plant - Lesprom Network
summary: Fletcher Building Limited has ordered a complete CEBRO plant for the production of Fine OSB from German machine and plant manufacturer Dieffenbacher. The plant will be built at Fletcher Building’s Laminex site in Taupo, in the center of the North Island. The new plant will include Dieffenbacher’s new Belt Dryer, which has a low thermal energy consumption and can use low-calorific energy from the waste heat of other plant components. The new CEBRO plant will replace a particleboard production line featuring an almost 50-year-old single-opening press supplied by Dieffenbacher to Fletcher Building in 1974.
green_innovation: TRUE, the innovation is a new plant that will use low-calorific energy from the waste heat of other plant components, thereby reducing the plant's environmental impact.
business_innovation: TRUE, the innovation is a new plant that will produce Fine OSB, a special type of board consisting of an OSB core layer covered top and bottom by layers of particleboard. This new product combines OSB’s excellent mechanical properties with the surface quality of particleboard.
green_product: TRUE, the innovation is a new type of board, Fine OSB, that combines OSB’s excellent mechanical properties with the surface quality of particleboard.
green_process: TRUE, the innovation is a new plant that will use a Belt Dryer, which has a low thermal energy consumption and can use low-calorific energy from the waste heat of other plant components.
